oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Magnetic studies on LiZn ferrite films
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DASH, J
VENKATARAMANI, N
KRISHNAN, R
DATE, SK
KULKARNI, SD
PRASAD, S
SHRINGI, SN
KISHAN, P
KUMAR, N
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we report the study of the magnetic properties of (Li0.5-x/2Mn0.1ZnxFe2.35-x/2O4) films with x = 0, 0.16, 0.32, 0.48. The alms were deposited on fused quartz substrates by rf sputtering technique under various deposition conditions. The magnetic properties of the films annealed at 750 degrees C are being reported. The M. values of the films deposited at a rf power of 240 W in argon atmosphere were found to be smaller than the corresponding bulk values. The M. value was found to be maximum at x = 0.32, similar to the bulk. The H-c values of the films are much higher than the bulk values and decrease as a function of x.
